body: Hi Mingbo, Great thanks to your immediate reply and patient help. And it really did work. As you said, I simplified the model with more control points by breaking up the form into 6 zones with the air wall between them. Each is made of planner surfaces.  [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/VQvbBACfG9rmOhagoImB9D2XEqWUsEBqQG7WArV1HhUMe51GD*6KKjJujtkVyPJ6DgrKGmVF6gJj-hR3vrsg7dvLUIkHqDCf/1.png) As you see, I can get the overall energy use values, but the "severe" issue still got me a little confused, I lost the surface values. I mean I am glad to have the result and grateful for your kind help. Meanwhile, I just felt curious about this issue. I checked the same issue in the discussion forum,  [http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/interior-so...](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/interior-solar-distribution-calculation), like this post.  So my question is, is it still my model's error or should I run the simulation without interior reflections using the Energy Simulation Par component? If so, how to handle in the Energy Simulation Par component. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/VQvbBACfG9owhdGzj1zsuOYZvetGnBK1nIlPLAwKioBhjKdVxKPdq0ExvAJ-8z6XVo4VTA09rT1CHeSrPCWghFKNCoS2YJip/2.png) Thank you again for your great help.
